title: MP Stephen Hepburn has been SUSPENDED by the Labour Party as it probes sexual harassment claim
text:
Labour MP Stephen Hepburn has been suspended by the party as it investigates claims of sexual harassment against him.

The 59-year-old Jarrow MP has been stripped of the party whip and his case has been sent to the opposition party's National Constitutional Committee, which oversees conduct.

The complaint concerns his behaviour towards a woman aged in her 20s in 2005 and he could face expulsion if he is found guilty, HuffPo UK reported.

The allegation first came to light in March but he was suspended today.

Mr Hepburn (left, with party leader Jeremy Corbyn in 2016) is the latest Labour MP to be suspended following allegations of sexual harassment, following a case against Kelvin Hopkins in 2017

Mr Hepburn is the latest Labour MP to be suspended following allegations of sexual harassment.

Former shadow culture secretary Kelvin Hopkins has been suspended for almost two years over allegations he targeted party activist Ava Etemadzadeh.

It is alleged Mr Hopkins, the Luton North MP, 'rubbed his crotch' on Ms Etemadzadeh and that he sent suggestive texts.

He denies all the allegations.

And in July last year Barrow MP John Woodcock quit the Labour Party to sit as an independent - complaining about a witch-hunt by Jeremy Corbyn's hard-left allies.

He had been suspended three months previously over claims he sent inappropriate texts to a female aide.

Barrow MP John Woodcock quit the Labour Party to sit as an independent - complaining about a witch-hunt by Jeremy Corbyn's hard-left allies

Former shadow culture secretary Kelvin Hopkins (far right) has been suspended for almost two years over allegations he targeted party activist Ava Etemadzadeh.

But the overt critic of Jeremy Corbyn denied the charge and said the process against him was being 'manipulated for factional purposes' by those close to the leader.

A Labour Party spokeswoman said today: 'The Labour Party takes all complaints of sexual harassment extremely seriously, which are fully investigated and any appropriate disciplinary action taken in line with the Party's rules and procedures.

'We are determined to challenge and overturn sexual harassment and misogyny within politics and across society as a whole.

'We cannot comment on individual complaints.'

It is understood that the panel who escalated the case was advised by an independent barrister.
description: The 59-year-old Jarrow MP has been stripped of the party whip and his case has been sent to the opposition party's National Constitutional Committee, which oversees conduct.
